info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 9:45PM EDT until June 22 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river and location in Indiana...
White River at Edwardsport.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river and location in Indiana...
White River at Elliston.
.Rainfall earlier this week brought new rises to area waterways. Waters are cresting or receding at nearly all locations. Flooding is now confined to the White River at Edwardsport in southwest Indiana where the river is falling and expected to go below flood stage no later than Sunday morning. Some locations on the Wabash River are near bankfull but are seeing water levels falling.
Weather will be conducive to seeing water levels continuing to fall and soils drying through Tuesday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Edwardsport.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of low agricultural fields begin. Daviess CR 375 WN and North River Rd in Knox County located inside the levees are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Saturday /6:00 PM CDT Saturday/ the stage was 15.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EDT Saturday /6:00 PM CDT Saturday/ was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Sunday morning by around 945 AM EDT /845 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
